alert.note: Alert for Northeast Aroostook; Northern Penobscot; Northern Piscataquis; Northern Somerset; Northwest Aroostook; Southeast Aroostook (Maine) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued December 21 at 2:51AM EST by NWS Caribou
info.description: ...Snow Showers and Possible Snow Squalls Today... A strong cold front will cross the region this morning and will be accompanied by snow showers and the potential for a heavier snow squall. Locally an inch or two of snow may accumulate in any heavier snow showers or squalls. A west to northwest wind will increase today with gusts to 35 mph. The strong wind will cause areas of blowing and drifting snow and locally poor visibility in open areas. Local white-outs are possible if any snow squalls materialize. The time period of greatest concern will be from 9 am until 2 pm today. The wind will diminish rapidly later this afternoon ending blowing and drifting snow. If you have travel plans today, be aware that conditions may change rapidly over short distances.

area.areaDesc: Northeast Aroostook; Northern Penobscot; Northern Piscataquis; Northern Somerset; Northwest Aroostook; Southeast Aroostook
